data.title: Sandra please find another job
data.text: We were there at 5:30 and we were the only people in there. Sandra did not greet us at all, just gave us a look like she didnt want us there. I ask for the sub of the day and she picked up chicken breast and i told her it was turkey day. She threw the chicken and continued to throw and slam things the entire time she made my sub and my husbands. When we finally paid for our subs I told her that I hoped her day got better because she seemed to be a woman who hated her job. She just turned around and walked in the back. Awful customer service.  Will not go back there, one experience with Sandra is enough.

data.title: Don't bother going in the one on 67th street!
data.text: I asked if I could get my lettuce in a separate bag, the girl rolled her eyes and said "no we aren't allowed to do that" . REALLY? Then she proceeded to the cash register, rang me up and went to "help"  the next customer with the same gloves on! Needless to say my sandwiches went in the trash!

data.title: Good Subway
data.text: Subway knows what they are doin every time, & they make hot & cold sandwiches & U get yr sandwhich done yr way, always good

data.title: Always scrimping
data.text: The downtown Subway is closest to us and what they do is fine; however, they are always out of something, this time it was spinich and bell peppers.  My wife got a salad and was informed that the owner will not order crackers or croutons.  The Subways at Cameron and out East are fine but the owner of this one needs to go into some other business or stop being such a tightwad.
